items.description: NICE Black. Part of the primary palette.
NICE White. Part of the primary palette
NICE Teal. Part of the primary palette. First choice of colour for supporting

Purple. Part of the secondary palette. Purple should be used sparingly and only used as a panel background to highlight a particular section of content, in which case font colour must be pure white (NICE White) to make text legible.
Cool Teal. Part of the secondary palette.
Rich Black. Part of the secondary palette.
Dark Grey. Part of the secondary palette.
Ice Teal. Part of the tertiary palette.
Body text colour for use on dark background

context.code: outline: 3px solid $colour-focus;

items.description: Services list - ie.g. service icon and name. Stacked on mobile, and side-by-side on larger screen widths

.social-networks

items.description: Footer navigation - list of links that stacks on mobile and is side-by-side on wider screen widths

context.name: .footer-nav

items.description:
Tabbed navigational structure

BEM elements:

  • __list The containing list of tabs
  • __tab An individual tab
  • __tab-btn A button within a tab
  • __content The tabs content - container for the
  • __pane An individual tab pane

context.name: .tabs

example.code:
Tab content 1
Tab content 2

context.name: .breadcrumbs
.btn
container

items.description:
Container. Used as a wrapper around sections within a page. Modifiers:

  • --narrow - Narrower version of the container
  • --full - Full width rather than maximum width
  • --panel - Adds a background colour

context.name: .container

items.description:
Maintains the aspect ratio of an embedded item, useful for responsive embedding, e.g. YouTube videos in iframes or video tags. Also useful when you know the ratio of an image and want to avoid the 'pop' for slow loading images.

Automatically applies to iframe, embed, object and video tags. Alternatively, you can use the __item selector to specify the element directly.

BEM elements:

  • __item

BEM modifiers:

  • --21-9
  • --16-9
  • --4-3
  • --square

context.name: .maintain-ratio

example.code: 4:3

items.description: A panel is a container for visually separating content. Often used within a sidebar.

A phase banner includes a tag and a label and is designed to designate that a service is in alpha or beta. Usually contains a .phase-tag.

BEM elements:

  • __tag The tag itself
  • __label The label explaining

context.name: .phase-banner

see.description:
A coloured block to designate a service being in alpha or beta. Can be used on its own but usually used within a .phase-banner.

BEM modifiers:

  • --alpha Alpha
  • --beta Beta
  • --live Live

context.name: .phase-tag

items.description:
A coloured block to designate a service being in alpha or beta. Can be used on its own but usually used within a .phase-banner.

BEM modifiers:

  • --alpha Alpha
  • --beta Beta
  • --live Live

context.name: .phase-tag

Distinguish private beta/public beta

Do we also need a discover phase colour?

items.description: Grid mixin for applying to custom classes when creating a custom component and creating 'semantic' (sensible) class names.

parameter.description: Whether the grid items flow the opposite way to their natural source order

parameter.name: gutterless
parameter.description: Whether the grid has no spacing

parameter.name: right
parameter.description: Whether to render items from the right instead of the left

parameter.name: center
parameter.description: Whether the grid's items are centrally aligned horizontally

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: Whether to put a highlight round the grid for debugging

items.description: Reversed grids allow you to structure your source in the opposite order to how your rendered layout will appear

items.description: Grid item default selector. Use within a .grid. Use the value of the data attribute to specify the grid item widths mobile first. E.g "n w:n" where n is the number of columns and w is the name of the breakpoint.

Grid item

items.description:
Grid class for the grid wrapper. Expects direct children to be [data-g] grid items. Use modifiers to affect grid behaviour as shown below:

Modifiers:

  • rev - Reverses the grid direction from natural source order
  • gutterless - Removes spacing and gutters from the grid
  • right - Right aligned grid items
  • center - Horizontally center aligned grid items
  • middle - Vertically middle aligned grid items
  • bottom - Bottom aligned grid items

context.name: .grid

example.code: Grid item

items.description: A map of glyph name to code (character entity reference). Avoids things like content: '\201C' throughout SASS. Usual usage is via the get-glyph function.

context.name: nice-glyphs
context.value:
(
  bullet: '2022',
  quotation-mark: '0022',
  greater-than: '003e',
  less-than: '003c',
  copyright: '00a9',
  left-double-quotation-mark: '201C',
  ne-double-arrow: '021D7',
  up-tee-arrow: '021A5',
  box-box: '029C9',
  punc-space: '02008'
  // Add more entity codes here as and when they're needed
)

see.description: Gets a glyph code, or several, (character entity reference) from the $nice-glyphs map, matching the given $names. Usually used with the content property for psuedo elements, to avoid use of magic character reference strings.

Map of icon name to codepoint. This map avoids the use of 'magic strings' for codepoints throught SASS code. The map is usually not used directly - use the nice-icon function/mixin instead. Please note - the values for codepoints are not fixed and may change each time the font is re-generated.

font-sizes
context.value:
(
  // sass-lint:disable-block space-around-operator
  -1: (
    fs: 14,
    lh: 4 * 5,
    fw: 400,
    mb: $spacing-medium,
    mt: $spacing-medium
  ),
  0: (

items.description: The modular scale ratio to use for typography
'Extra large' break point for wide screens
The default root font size in pixels
Whether to output a default set of generic print styles for things like avoiding page breaks after headings etc. If you disabled this, be sure to add your own print styles.
Whether to output the classes for the UTF-8 glyphs.
Whether the site is responsive. Setting to false will disable generation of the responsie grid selectors. True by default.

variable.description: NICE Black. Part of the primary palette.
NICE White. Part of the primary palette
NICE Teal. Part of the primary palette. First choice of colour for supporting

Purple. Part of the secondary palette. Purple should be used sparingly and only used as a panel background to highlight a particular section of content, in which case font colour must be pure white (NICE White) to make text legible.
Cool Teal. Part of the secondary palette.
Rich Black. Part of the secondary palette.
Dark Grey. Part of the secondary palette.
Ice Teal. Part of the tertiary palette.
Body text colour for use on dark background

css.description:
Tabbed navigational structure

BEM elements:

  • __pane An individual tab pane

css.description:
Container. Used as a wrapper around sections within a page. Modifiers:

  • --narrow - Narrower version of the container
  • --full - Full width rather than maximum width
  • --panel - Adds a background colour

context.name: .container

css.description:
Maintains the aspect ratio of an embedded item, useful for responsive embedding, e.g. YouTube videos in iframes or video tags. Also useful when you know the ratio of an image and want to avoid the 'pop' for slow loading images.

Automatically applies to iframe, embed, object and video tags. Alternatively, you can use the __item selector to specify the element directly.

BEM elements:

  • __item

BEM modifiers:

  • --21-9
  • --16-9
  • --4-3
  • --square

context.name: .maintain-ratio

example.code: 4:3

css.description: A panel is a container for visually separating content. Often used within a sidebar.

A phase banner includes a tag and a label and is designed to designate that a service is in alpha or beta. Usually contains a .phase-tag.

BEM elements:

  • __tag The tag itself
  • __label The label explaining

context.name: .phase-banner

see.description:
A coloured block to designate a service being in alpha or beta. Can be used on its own but usually used within a .phase-banner.

BEM modifiers:

  • --alpha Alpha
  • --beta Beta
  • --live Live

A coloured block to designate a service being in alpha or beta. Can be used on its own but usually used within a .phase-banner.

css.description:
Grid class for the grid wrapper. Expects direct children to be [data-g] grid items. Use modifiers to affect grid behaviour as shown below:

Modifiers:

  • rev - Reverses the grid direction from natural source order
  • gutterless - Removes spacing and gutters from the grid
  • right - Right aligned grid items
  • center - Horizontally center aligned grid items
  • middle - Vertically middle aligned grid items
  • bottom - Bottom aligned grid items

context.name: .grid

example.code: Grid item

variable.description: The modular scale ratio to use for typography
'Extra large' break point for wide screens
The default root font size in pixels
Whether to output a default set of generic print styles for things like avoiding page breaks after headings etc. If you disabled this, be sure to add your own print styles.
Whether to output the classes for the UTF-8 glyphs.
Whether the site is responsive. Setting to false will disable generation of the responsie grid selectors. True by default.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: The name of the scale

return.description: The numeric scale ratio for the given name

throw: Scale with name #{$scale} could not be found in the $scales map
